episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky historical and contemporary facts, including a near-war between Brazil and France over lobsters, a medieval man who drove his entire village away, the regret of the Labradoodle's inventor, and the original meaning of the term 'shit-faced.'

facts.fact: In the 1960s, Brazil and France almost went to war with each other over whether lobsters crawl or swim.
In 1350, there was a man called William Stand Up Right who annoyed everyone else in his village so much that every single one of them moved away.
The man who invented the Australian Labradoodle deeply, deeply regrets it.
The word shit-faced originally meant having a very small face.
